title: Custom components do not render on Korean Windows
body:
### Checklist

- [X] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar issues.
- [X] I added a very descriptive title to this issue.
- [X] I have provided sufficient information below to help reproduce this issue.

### Summary

Streamlit custom components are not rendered when using the korean version of windows. The exact same configuration (i.e. copying the file tree including the python environment) works fine on the us version of Windows. I suspect that it might be somehow related to [this](https://github.com/winfsp/winfsp/issues/302). Simply changing the locale did not allow me to reproduces the issue on the us version of windows though. This is referring to a local deployment.

### Reproducible Code Example

```Python
import os
import streamlit.components.v1 as st_components

parent_dir = os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(__file__))
# Contains index.html
build_dir = os.path.join(parent_dir, '..', "js-component", "dist")
_component_func = st_components.declare_component("flash_viewer_grid", path=build_dir)

out_components = []
data_for_drawing = {}
component_key = "flash_viewer_grid"

component_value = _component_func(component=out_components, data_for_drawing=data_for_drawing, key=component_key)
```


### Steps To Reproduce

_No response_

### Expected Behavior

Display of the custom component.

### Current Behavior

The component is not found:
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1e179f2b-0c63-48d5-ab36-f46250ebfe51)

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this used to work in a previous version.

### Debug info

- Streamlit version: 1.34.0
- Python version: 3.11
- Operating System: Windows 11 (Korean)
- Browser: Microsoft Edge


### Additional Information

_No response_
